utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, God. Shoot me now.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d rather not. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ensign Klemp has just been promoted to Captain. He’s going to run the Nine Two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is Ensign Klemp and why hasn’t he changed his name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We went to the Academy together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, and he’s your sworn nemesis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. He was my friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he’s grossly underqualified?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, he’s great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then what’s the problem?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Me. We started together, we graduated together, and he’s going to be Captain and I’m just –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The best homicide detective in the city?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I’m falling behind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what you’ve got? Patterson syndrome.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Patterson syndrome?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Every time I write a best seller, Patterson writes, like, six. It’s maddening. But comparing myself to him does not make me write any faster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I guess that I just thought that I would be in more of a leadership by now. I don’t know. Maybe I shouldn’t have left the AG’s office in DC.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except you didn’t want to compromise yourself to play their game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I feel like maybe there’s something more I should be doing.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Castles. Our victim is one Henry Graham. Took a single GSW to the chest around midnight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So someone must have heard the gunshot. Do we have a witness?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, as a matter of fact. That jogger right there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he see the murder?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but the killer was still looking though the vic’s pockets when he jogged up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m surprised he didn’t get shot, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So is he. She had the drop on him and told him to run. Probably set a personal best.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our killer’s a she?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Asian female, mid 30s. Well dressed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doesn’t fit the profile of a typical mugger.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Neither does the stuff that she took from the vic’s pockets. She made off with his cell phone and his keys, but left his wallet and two hundred bucks in cash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this was more than just a late night stickup.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, why don’t we get the witness together with a sketch artist.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Already in the works. And to hear the jogger tell it, this chick was cool as could be. She may be a pro.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It does raise the question: what was Henry doing here so late at night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Waiting for someone. CSU found cigarette butts that match the pack in his pocket.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And if he was up to no good it wouldn’t be his first time. He did a nickel at Elmira for aggravated assault. Got out a few years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s still got his work uniform on, so let’s see if anyone at Go Quick Towing knows how he wound up here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, who would? Did he have any family?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even though he had a record?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have problems with anyone that you know of?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He did? By whom?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, I thought that he was tow-truck driver.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Henry was a repo man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So these threats that he got. Did any of them ever come from an Asian woman?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Still. We’ll need a list of the repos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where exactly did he go to lunch?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was strange about that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I spoke to Henry’s colleagues. None of them knows where he went to lunch yesterday or why he was asking for the X5 codes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe our repo man was actually stealing cars. He clearly had the skill set.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but from everything that everyone said, including Henry’s former parole officer, he was just a standup citizen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that was because he was concealing his car-stealing ways. Even his boss said he was a very private guy. So unbeknownst to anyone, Henry sets his eyes on an X5. He gets the alarm codes, but in a fateful error he steals the X5 belonging to this one. A Triad assassin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: An assassin? Really? Again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. This time it fits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How does it fit? He steals her car and she kills him? Why doesn’t she just put in an insurance claim and call it a day?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Because it wasn’t about the car. See, when Henry stole the vehicle he took something of value from the inside. That’s what the assassin was trying to retrieve from his pocket.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And said stolen item was?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cold fusion technology. Genetically engineered super virus. Some secret unpublished Harry Potter manuscript.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, one thing you said does make sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: The X5 might have something to do with Henry’s death. You know what? I’m going to call auto theft and see if there are any reported stolen X5s recently.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From a Triad assassin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s not a Triad assassin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: GLADYS
utterance.content: This is just so terrible. Henry was such a decent man. I wish all my tenants were like him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m sure you do. Ma’am, have you seen this woman before?

utterance.speaker: GLADYS
utterance.content: Well I – I believe I have.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here? In this building?

utterance.speaker: GLADYS
utterance.content: Why yes. We passed each other in the hall. She was headed for Henry’s unit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When was this?

utterance.speaker: GLADYS
utterance.content: Oh, about … ten minutes ago?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ten minutes ago?

utterance.speaker: GLADYS
utterance.content: Uh, maybe less? Does she have something to do with what happened to Henry?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ma’am, what’s Henry’s apartment number?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bedroom.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR ZHANG
utterance.content: Now hand me your backup weapon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here’s his backup. Drop it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You better think this through. We’re the cops.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: So am I. Hong Kong PD. Now, who’s the lead investigator on this case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re awfully far from Hong Kong, Chief Inspector Zhang.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Are these handcuffs truly necessary?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You attacked two NYPD detectives.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Only because I had no idea they were police.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, you mean to tell me, she got both your guns.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. You weren’t there. She’s fast. I mean like, crazy fast.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Please. She ain’t all that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet she got both your guns.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It says here that you are part of a US-Chinese organized taskforce based in San Francisco. What are you doing in New York?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Detective, let’s cut to the chase, shall we? I am not the murderer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So do you always make a habit of finding dead bodies and relieving them of their belongings?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I know Henry. Rather, I knew him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: It’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was he involved in one of your investigations?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: He was a friend. We hadn’t seen each other in years. We made plans to meet here, in the city, and then he called me and told me he couldn’t come. He sounded frightened. I asked him what was going on and he told me he was in trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of trouble?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: He wouldn’t say. I called back, he never answered. I was worried, so I flew out right away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you end up at the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: When Henry didn’t return my calls I had a colleague in San Francisco ping his cell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you found him in the park?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: When I got there he was already dead. So I took his phone and his keys and I began to investigate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why didn’t you call us from the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Because I didn’t want to waste my time having this conversation. My friend had been murdered. I have to find out who did it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I do.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Detective, I just got off with the TSA. Chief Inspector Zhang’s flight didn’t arrive until midnight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is when Henry was killed.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: She couldn’t have done it.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Now may I go?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: As long as you promise that you’re not going to work this case.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: That’s a promise I cannot make. And you no longer have cause to hold me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Chief Inspector, in the interest of all parties perhaps you should consider working with us.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I would like my effects returned to me now.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Take a peek at this. It’s Zhang’s personnel file. She’s more than just some cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. That US-Chinese taskforce. She’s not just on it, she’s running it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. Commendations, citations. Oh my gosh, she is impressive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, sure. On paper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the way she schooled Ryan and Esposito. Is that just on paper?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Captain. I’ve been thinking about your proposal and I do see the advantage of us working together. Does the offer still stand?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Okay. Then let’s start with this. You had mentioned that before Henry died, he had gone to lunch and returned upset. I had found that receipt in his pocket.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From The Jade Temple restaurant in Chinatown. It’s time stamped yesterday afternoon.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Why don’t the three of you check it out? See if there’s anything about his lunch that can explain why he got killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi. I’m Castle. We’re partners. Actually – we’re also married.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Interesting arrangement.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. This is going to be fun, this little threesome here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Investigatively speaking. I don’t want – didn’t mean to – I’m not trying to imply that –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Quit while you’re behind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: Hello. Table for three?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. Not today. Detective Beckett. NYPD.

utterance.speaker: MIMI TAN
utterance.content: You are the police? I’m Mimi Tan. This is my establishment. What can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’d like to ask you some questions about one of your customers.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: Oh. Not one of my customers. He’s my number one customer. Henry eats here every day.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Not anymore. He was murdered.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: This is tragic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When Henry was here yesterday, did he say that anything was wrong or that he was having problems with anyone?

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: No, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Her. Was she working here yesterday?

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: Zhu Yin? Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll go talk to her.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I’ll go talk to her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if I just stay here while you …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Zhu Yin? Detective Beckett, NYPD. We’d like a word.

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: I don’t want trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. You’re not in any trouble. We just need to ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: I know nothing. I must work now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She knows more than she’s letting on. It’s like she’s afraid to talk to us.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Us, or perhaps you. Her dialect indicates she’s from the Chongqing region. The police corruption is rampant there. Let me talk to her in her native language. Put her at ease.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um… did she just take over your interview?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. She’s more than qualified, Castle. Did you know she was the youngest officer to become Chief Inspector? She has cleared more murders than anyone in Hong Kong PD history.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so she’s good at her job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not just that. Take a look at her husband. Action movie star.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, well, I’m a highly paid novelist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the kids. Cute, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh … I’ve seen cuter. That’s – please tell me you’re not comparing yourself to her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. We’re –

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: She said there was an incident yesterday. A customer refused to order lunch. He said he was waiting for someone. Apparently he just checked his email until Henry arrived. He joined Henry at his table. An argument broke out and he finally left, but not before he told Henry “you cannot walk away from this”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does Zhu Yin know what they were fighting about?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: No, she didn’t get a good look at him. She said he was white, 40s, average height, average weight.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Is there a password required for the Wi-Fi?

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: No. Wi-Fi is free.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you thinking?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: If the man connected his phone to the Wi-Fi the router would have logged his unique MAC address. We can use that to track his name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you see that? She might have just broken this case with a Wi-Fi sign.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, I’m impressed. Are you happy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle. She’s just like me. Only better.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: So I traced all the devices that used the restaurants Wi-Fi during the time Henry was there. Only one is owned by a man fitting our suspect’s description. Michael Glassman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. We should send a copy of this over to Zhu Yin.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I already did. And she positively identified him as the one Henry was having the argument with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does Glassman have a criminal record?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Actually, quite the opposite.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, is this right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Who’s this guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s an FBI agent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Agent Glassman, hi. I’m Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for coming in.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MICHAEL GLASSMAN
utterance.content: Well, we’re all on the same team, right? Law enforcement synergy. So what can I do for the NYPD?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re looking into the death of Henry Graham and we’re hoping you can fill in the blanks.

utterance.speaker: GLASSMAN
utterance.content: Henry Graham? I’m afraid that name doesn’t ring a bell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, this man right here? You don’t recognize him?

utterance.speaker: GLASSMAN
utterance.content: No, I don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Agent Glassman, we know that you had contact with our victim. You were seen with him, yesterday, at the Jade Temple Restaurant, together, having a heated argument.

utterance.speaker: GLASSMAN
utterance.content: Somebody gave you a bum tip. I was never at any Jade Temple.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your phone was. Along with someone who bore a striking resemblance to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then hours later Henry ended up dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you at midnight last night?

utterance.speaker: GLASSMAN
utterance.content: Trust me, Detective Beckett, you do not want to go there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So much for law enforcement synergy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He out and out lied about knowing Henry. He’s in this thing up to his bolo tie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only we don’t know what this thing is. You know, I’m going to see if Captain Gates can talk to the Bureau. Maybe she can shake some info loose. What about you? Do you have anything?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … yeah. But I’m not quite sure what to make of it yet. The lab found phenol formaldehyde resin on the bottom of Henry’s shoes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Formaldehyde? Like for embalming?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, for embalming, making circuit boards, treatment of fabrics, all kinds of stuff. They think that he must have been somewhere where that chemical was used right before he died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he stepped in the formaldehyde right before he stole the X5.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He didn’t jack any X5. I checked. There were no X5s reported stolen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what was he was doing with those alarm codes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if Henry left work at 2PM, showed up dead at midnight, he’s unaccounted for for 10 hours, so where was he during that time?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, he didn’t own a car so I’ll check the activity on his Metro and credit cards, see if he went anywhere.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll circle back with his neighbors, see if they saw him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, call me if you guys find anything.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For a second there I thought I was going to get stuck doing thankless grunt work tonight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle. We’re standing right here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, tonight. Sorry, I forgot to tell you. I’m going out with Zhang tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is … um … you think that’s a good idea?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, we’re working together. We should get to know each other better. Anyway, don’t wait up for me, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Take a seat, Castle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let me tell you a little something about life. You see, what you did there, Castle … rookie mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’d I do?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You tried to stop her. I mean, Jenny, she’s got her girl’s nights and I’m totally fine with that. You see, in a marriage you have to give your partner some space.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, Ryan. This is my third marriage. I think I know what I’m doing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Richard, why don’t you want her to go?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, it’s not a secret that Zhang is … accomplished, and Beckett admires her for that. Even envies her. So if they hang out I’m just afraid it’s going to be some sort of weird competition.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Come on, Beckett would never do that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, bro. This is Beckett we’re talking about. It’s a girl’s night out. It won’t be a competition.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Not bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks. I’m uh … little rusty though.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Me too. I haven’t been to a range in six months.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s after six months?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: It’s hard to find time to practice with my duties in Hong Kong, San Fran, The Hague.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you work at The Hague?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: With the International War Crimes Tribunal. Trust me, it’s not as glamorous as it sounds. But when you reach the peak of a mountain it’s time to scale another one, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. So, uh … team leader, a wife, a mom. Isn’t it a struggle to do it all?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: The trick is to not struggle but to find balance. The moment you think it’s a struggle, that’s when you fall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, there’s one thing that doesn’t add up, though. I mean, given who you are.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: How Henry and I know each other. Because we come from such different worlds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: My parents worked as house staff for the Chinese mission to the U.N. I ended up in public school here in the city. I didn’t speak much English, got bullied for it. Henry stood up for me. I couldn’t stop what he became, but we never stopped being friends.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somehow the fact that you did this makes you even more attractive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah? Well, tell it to Zhang.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is her target?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And she had ten others just like it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, well, so she’s a good shot. Big deal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s good at everything! She’s got an incredible career, movie star husband, perfect kids. She does it all, she has it all, and to top it off she’s gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, she is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, you think she’s gorgeous?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I … was just agreeing with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, but did you think it before I said it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God, Castle. I haven’t felt like this since I had pimples.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m insecure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not insecure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, if I’m not insecure then why did you say what you just said?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, look. You’re doing it again. It’s Patterson syndrome. I knew it was a bad idea for you to go out with her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. Castle, I just wanted to see what made Zhang tick. You know, how she achieved what she did so maybe that could help me move forward.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, you don’t need her help. You’re doing just fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but when you reach the peak of one mountain isn’t it time to scale another one?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That sounds like something Zhang would say. Are you quoting her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look. You’re idealizing Zhang. You’re comparing yourself to a version of her that doesn’t even exist. She is a human, like the rest of us, flaws and all. Not some infallible super cop who swoops in every time to save the day.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Zhang just got a lead that could crack this case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were saying?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I was scanning surveillance video of Henry’s apartment complex, trying to piece together the timeline on the day he died, when I saw this.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: That’s Henry. Note the time: 2:37PM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meaning, after Henry left the repo yard he went back home.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Except he didn’t stay. Five minutes later he left his apartment complex. Watch what happens next.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Before he was killed, Henry Graham was kidnapped.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tech was able to pull the numbers off the license plate. The SUV is registered to a William "Billy" Hicks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to my buddies in narcotics, this guy’s hard core. Every year he makes their top twenty list for drug dealers. But they’ve never been able to nail him, mostly because he has other guys do his dirty work.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I know this man. Billy Hicks started Henry on a life of crime. Hired him as an enforcer. He’s the reason that Henry went to prison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, he’s probably the reason Henry was murdered.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: But Henry hasn’t worked for Hicks in almost ten years. Why would Hicks come after him now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe Henry knew too much. About Hicks and the organization. That’s probably why Glassman approached him at the Jade Temple. The FBI is building a case against Hicks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Glassman wanted Henry to roll.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, if Henry refused, that explains why Glassman and he fought.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter if he refused. If a man like Hicks thought Henry was talking to the FBI, he would stop at nothing to protect his empire and eliminate the threat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where do we find Hicks?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He operates out of a gym he owns in Queens, O’Donnell’s Boxing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective, wait. I need a word with you.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You can’t go after Hicks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Orders straight from 1PP.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did they say why?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Just that it’s a federal matter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I’m right. Hicks is being investigated by the Feds.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And they don’t want us screwing up their case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, he could be our killer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: They are aware of that. They need us to wait.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For how long?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Until indictments come down.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: And when exactly do they expect these indictments? Days? Weeks? Months?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know. But until then we’ve been ordered to stand down from this investigation.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: What are you saying? That my friend is dead and I can do nothing? Is that what you’re telling me, Detective Beckett? Where is the justice in that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s not wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, even though we can’t approach Hicks, we can build a case. Gather evidence against him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll start by combing street cams, see if we can find out where that SUV went after Henry was taken.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll send a team to the crime scene to canvas the park, see if anyone remembers seeing that SUV.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, we should talk to Zhang. See what else she knows about Henry and Hicks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zhang?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, did Zhang circle back through here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, she stormed off that way, didn’t she?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you don’t think –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. O’Donnell’s Boxing Gym.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She’s going after Hicks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll get her. She’s my responsibility.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: If you’re looking for the Pilates studio, it’s across the street.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I’m looking for your boss. There? Hicks.

utterance.speaker: BILLY HICKS
utterance.content: Step aside, Tony. Make a lady feel welcome here. Especially someone as – as lovely as this delicate flower.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: What can I do you for, Miss –

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Zhang. I’d like to discuss a mutual friend. Henry Graham?

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Sorry, I don’t know that name.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Oh, I think you do.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: You don’t want to do that. You might get hurt.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Funny. I was going to say the same thing to him.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Wrong move, sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Help me!

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Help me! Please, help me!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zhang, step away!

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Leave us, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t make me ask again.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Say goodbye, sister, because I am pressing charges. Now arrest this crazy b*tch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right after I arrest you.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have a video of you abducting Henry Graham outside his apartment.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Abduct? We gave him a ride.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: By forcing him into your SUV?

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Come on, that was a gag. Okay? My boys were just messing with him. We do that stuff all the time. Ask Henry.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: That’s going to be hard, seeing as you killed him.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Wait. Henry’s dead? Okay, I had nothing to do with that. All I did was help him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Help him with what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t want to talk to me? Fine. You can talk to her.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Okay, look. He came to me last week needing a favor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of favor?

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Let’s just say he needed something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did he want?

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Hypothetically?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, fine. Hypothetically.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Let’s say, and this is just an example, that he wanted half a kilo of coke.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Why would Henry need cocaine?

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Let’s just assume in this particular example that he said he was trying to help a friend get out of a bad situation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was the friend and what were they going to do with the coke?

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Maybe he didn’t say and I didn’t ask. Maybe I told him he shouldn’t get back in the game. It’s too dangerous. But he said it was just a one-time deal.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: You’re lying. Henry would never sell drugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, Zhang! Zhang!

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Maybe we’re talking about different Henrys. Because the one in my example asked for it to be divided into smaller 8-balls.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: Look, Detective. Henry served me well back in the day. When the shipment was ready I had him picked up. Not abducted. I gave him the coke he needed. He was so grateful he even told me about the Feds watching my place. How they saw him leaving here last week and they tried to get him to roll on me. Hypothetically, of course.

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: And that was the last I heard of him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s just say that you’re telling the truth. Did he tell you where he was going with the drugs?

utterance.speaker: HICKS
utterance.content: No. But when my boys took him back to the city he didn’t go home. He wanted out on 53rd and 1st.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Ryan. Look, Hicks could be lying about everything. We’ve still got to send a patrol to canvass 53rd and 1st, just in case. Yeah, look for witnesses. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: They should also pull traffic camera footage of the area.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is not your call. Not anymore. What the hell were you thinking?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I did what I had to!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Without any regard for the Feds, for the NYPD, for me. Is that what you call being balanced?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Okay, you want to know about being balanced? My husband and I are separated. I am not the mother I should be. You think I’m this amazing cop, that I have it all together, but I don’t. I’m the reason that Henry’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you taking about?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Henry called the other week. He left a message saying that – – he needed my help. I didn’t think it was important so I didn’t call him back right away and when I did it was too late. He told me no one could help him anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why you hopped on that plane?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Growing up Henry was always there for me, protecting me. And when he needed me I was too busy. I am always too busy for everything that really matters. That’s why I need to do this. Not just for Henry. For me.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: This is all my fault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It sure is.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I’m going in. She shouldn’t take the blame.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. She wouldn’t take it if she didn’t want to. Believe me, Beckett has plenty of experience taking a bullet for other people doing stupid things. Hell, she’s married to me. But uh … you super cops need to stick together, right?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I told her that you left before you knew Hicks was off limits.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Did she believe you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She … chose to believe me.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Thank you, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the best way to thank me is to help us solve the case.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so, we got a hit off that canvass. Unis, they found a street vendor who works near the corner of 53rd and 1st who saw Henry loitering around a residential parking garage the day of the murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Seeing that Henry’s a repo man we contacted the building manager to get a list of all the vehicles parked there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And one of them was a 2013 X5.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Those alarm codes that Henry requested.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who owns the car?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy. Jeffrey Wadlow. He’s a wealthy businessman in property development with a history of drug charges.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That his high powered attorneys always got dismissed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Until the other day, because after receiving an anonymous tip to the police that Wadlow was selling drugs, they pulled him over and found half a kilo of cocaine separated out into 8-balls stashed inside the car.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: That means Henry wasn’t selling drugs. He was planting them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there a connection between Henry and Wadlow?

utterance.speaker: EPSOSITO
utterance.content: Not that we could find.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s Wadlow now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Central booking, awaiting arraignment for felony distribution charges.

utterance.speaker: HENRY WADLOW
utterance.content: Who the hell is Henry Graham?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, Mr. Wadlow. I’ve got detectives digging into your life looking for ties between the two of you.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: And it’s going to be worse for you if you say you don’t know Henry and we find out you do.

utterance.speaker: WADLOW
utterance.content: But I don’t know him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why would he plant drugs in your car?

utterance.speaker: WADLOW
utterance.content: Yes. I told the cops they were planted. Finally someone who believes me. Hey, hey. If you know it was this guy then I can get out of here, right?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Not when you reached out and hired someone to murder Henry.

utterance.speaker: WADLOW
utterance.content: Murder? I would never have someone killed. Especially someone I’ve never even seen before.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: If you don’t know Henry then why would he try to frame you?

utterance.speaker: WADLOW
utterance.content: I have no idea. Maybe somebody put him up to it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like who?

utterance.speaker: WADLOW
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe somebody who – somebody who doesn’t like the way I do business. A competitor, maybe?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who stands to gain by you going to prison, Mr. Wadlow?

utterance.speaker: WADLOW
utterance.content: A whole lot of people.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wadlow’s in the clear for the murder. He was locked up at the time of the death.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Could he have ordered Henry’s execution while detained?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … he made one phone call. To his lawyer. And he didn’t manage to get through until Henry was already dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. Been combing through Wadlow’s business dealings and we came across something that might be connected to our case.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Over the past six months Wadlow’s been buying up real estate for his next new development. In Chinatown. And each time he did he outbid the same rival company.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: VCN Holdings. And the woman who runs VCN also happens to own a little restaurant called The Jade Temple.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mimi Tan is behind this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s right. It’s one of dozens of businesses she owns and not all of them are on the up and up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Organized crime tells us that Mimi Tan’s rumored to be linked to human trafficking.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She staffs her businesses with illegals that she smuggles from China via a network of Triads.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But now she’s looking to go legit and she sees the Chinatown development as her ticket to respectability.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: So the fact that Henry was eating at her restaurant every day was not a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mimi must have persuaded her number one customer to plant those drugs on Wadlow to eliminate the competition.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then once Henry completed his task Mimi had him eliminated.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Only how do we prove it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going to need something stronger than just the lunch special.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, ask and ye shall receive. Do you remember that phenol formaldehyde resin that the lab found on the bottom of Henry’s shoes? Well, it might have come from a garment factory a few blocks from the park where Henry was shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What makes you say that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because. That factory is owned by Mimi Tan.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: Hello again. Joining us for dinner this time, I hope?

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Uh, no. Not tonight. Actually, we were hoping that you could help us a little more with Henry’s murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: Of course. Whatever I can do to help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jeffrey Wadlow. Do you know him? He’s a local developer.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: I know of him. Very unscrupulous.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Perhaps so. He was arrested for drug charges the other day.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: How unfortunate for him.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: And how fortunate for you. Wadlow goes to prison, all his recent real estate deals fall apart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Making room for your company to swoop in and buy numerous Chinatown properties.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: And what does this have to do with Henry’s death?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You enlisted Henry to plant those drugs in Wadlow’s car to get rid of your competition.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: That’s absurd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it? We found phenol formaldehyde resin under Henry’s shoe, the same kind that’s used at your garment factory near the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: We talked to several of your workers who saw you with Henry at the factory the night he was murdered.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: I want to talk to my lawyer now.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Why did you do it? To tie up loose ends, is that it?

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: I’m not saying another word until –

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: It was you! You killed him! You –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait! Hey!

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Step back!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Henry didn’t come here for the food.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: He came here for you.

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: He was going to take me away. Free me. And you killed him.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: I did not kill Henry.

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: You lie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean, he came here to free you?

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: I owe much money to the smugglers who bring me here. She buy my debt. I work here to pay it off. For years.

utterance.speaker: MIMI
utterance.content: That’s not true.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: And then you met Henry.

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: He want us to start a life together. He went to Mimi to pay my debt. Forty thousand dollars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Henry didn’t have that kind of cash so you made a different agreement for Zhu Yin’s release.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: You had Henry frame Wadlow for her freedom.

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: He did that for me? That’s why he say for me to meet him at the park that night. He say he would have good news.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait. So you were the one he was waiting for at the park?

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: No. I was supposed to. But Henry phoned me. He say not to come.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: He canceled?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he tell you why?

utterance.speaker: ZHU YIN
utterance.content: I did not speak to him. He call here and left a message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zhu Yin, who gave you that message?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks, Mei Wu. We just need to clear up a few details. This shouldn’t take too long.

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: Of course. Henry was a good man.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Yes, he was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, Zhu Yin told us that you were working at the restaurant the night the night that Henry was killed. She said that you gave her a message. Is that correct?

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: Yes. I’m sorry, did I do something wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll say so. You lied to her, just like you’re lying to us right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We checked Henry’s phone records. He never called the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: He must have used a different phone. I did speak with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course you did. When you confronted him at the park.

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: What park?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your metro card shows that you entered the subway across the street during Henry’s time of death window.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Zhu Yin told us about your friendship. How you grew up together, how you both came here, how hard it was. How you both owe a debt to Mimi Tan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But that was all about to change. You realized that Henry was going to clear Zhu Yin’s debt and take her away from you. And you could not allow that to happen.

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: Please, I did nothing wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: CSU recovered blood micro-sprays on clothes found in your apartment. That blood matches Henry’s.

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: No, no. This is a mistake.

utterance.speaker: MEI WU
utterance.content: Zhu Yin is all I have here. And she was going to leave me. I had to do something. I had to!

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Mei Wu, you’re under arrest for the murder of Henry Graham.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How’s Zhu Yin doing?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: She’s strong. She’ll be all right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, um … a bit of good news? I spoke with immigration and in exchange for Zhu Yin testifying against Mimi Tan they are going to grant her asylum. She’s going to be able to stay in the US, but free this time.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Just as Henry wanted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what are you going to do now?

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: I don’t know. Pick up where I left off, pick up the pieces. Try to find my balance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s easier said than done. Good luck, Inspector.

utterance.speaker: ZHANG
utterance.content: Thank you, Kate. For everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, you think you and Zhang will stay in touch?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I hope so. I mean, us super cops need to stick together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not trying to break my high score on Fruit Ninja, are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I’m writing up a list of priorities for my future.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. New mountains to climb. Well, what’s it going to be? Fuji? Kilimanjaro? Everest?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know yet. I mean, I love what I do but I feel like I have to find a new challenge. It’s kind of like when you killed off Derek Storm because you were bored.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, yeah. Look how that turned out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm. Yeah. Well, whatever’s next, I don’t want to have to compromise my priorities to get there, and – – I never want to be guilty of leaving behind what matters most.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You cannot leave behind what is always by your side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you just make that up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You are so much better than Patterson.
